description: Peter Blume often spent years on a single painting; this work took four years to complete. As is often the case with Blume's work, the complex imagery—a shattered red rock resting on top of a base that is being demolished by the workers below—resists easy interpretation. It may point to devastation and reconstruction, reflecting the turbulence of World War II and its aftermath.
artist_info:
Peter Blume (American
born Smorgon, Russian Empire, now Belarus, 1906–1992)
title: The Rock
